newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwe bank governor calls for tax incentives.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwe bank governor calls for tax incentives.

text.p: Zimbabwe central bank governor Leonard Tsumba urged the government on Friday to introduce tax incentives in next month's budget to attract vital foreign investment.
In a speech at a business seminar, the governor of the Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe (RBZ) said there was need to boost economic activity through tax incentives, especially for exporting companies.

"This can be achieved by (the) government offering investors (measures) such as investment allowances and grants, tax holidays and the provision of accelerated depreciation allowances which would offer more tax relief than straight line depreciation."
President Robert Mugabe's government is due to unveil its annual budget on July 24.

The southern Africa country -- whose economic growth has averaged less than two percent annually over the last 10 years -- had managed to attract only around $120 million of about $90 billion of global direct foreign investment in emerging markets in 1995, Tsumba said.
